heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 13 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.6°C), outside temperature (down 2.0°C), and inside temperature (down 1.6°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 166 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 2.9°C), cloud levels (up 323 m), and inside temperature (up 2.7°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 165.9m higher than yesterday, 47.1m lower than the past week, 322.8m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 926m minimum and 1357m maximum, with an average of 1251.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1298.1m and 1573.8m.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, occasional overcast conditions, and the light is absent. Stable weather patterns due to high pressure.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
